content.raw: This sounds like a good idea. I couldn't get `\snippet` to work with `.sdf` files though. I think they are filtered out by [doxygen](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/126d3fd87e884fc6b87e4b35e4bc1453f414ef12/doc/doxygen/api.in#lines-869)

content.raw: At some point, it would be nice to be able to reattach the models, so I don't think we should remove the joint. We don't support reattaching right now because of the contents of the two models are merged together in DART when the joint is created/activated and it's difficult to unmerge them.
content.html: At some point, it would be nice to be able to reattach the models, so I don't think we should remove the joint. We don't support reattaching right now because of the contents of the two models are merged together in DART when the joint is created/activated and it's difficult to unmerge them.

content.raw:
+1

I also want to bring up in the next meeting the idea of not adding "required" components to `Each` calls in released versions
content.html:
+1

I also want to bring up in the next meeting the idea of not adding "required" components to Each calls in released versions

content.raw: Noted. It would be nice to come up with a way to check for and use optional features before making it a breaking change though.
content.html: Noted. It would be nice to come up with a way to check for and use optional features before making it a breaking change though.

content.raw: Good catch! I added an error message if the element is missing in f5b2918. If `validConfig` is not set to true, the `PreUpdate` won't do anything so the check can be done here.
content.html: Good catch! I added an error message if the element is missing in f5b2918. If validConfig is not set to true, the PreUpdate won't do anything so the check can be done here.

update.description:
Adds a system that initially attaches two models via a fixed joint and allows for the models to get detached during simulation via a topic. 

Needs [ign-physics PR #102](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/102)
update.title: Detachable joint system

content.raw: Works for me! I just have some minor comments. Also, please bump the required `ign-physics` version to 1.5.0.
content.html: Works for me! I just have some minor comments. Also, please bump the required ign-physics version to 1.5.0.

content.raw:
Thanks for adding a tutorial! Some other suggestions:

1. Include a `\snippet` of the world file that shows the plugin and any other relevant bits
1. Include the example commands that you listed on the world file
content.html:
Thanks for adding a tutorial! Some other suggestions:

  1. Include a \snippet of the world file that shows the plugin and any other relevant bits
  2. Include the example commands that you listed on the world file

content.raw: Since this is a generic tutorial, how about explicitly mentioning DART as the physics engine?
content.html: Since this is a generic tutorial, how about explicitly mentioning DART as the physics engine?

content.raw: To downstream users, this could just be referred to as `detachable_joint.sdf`, because that's how they can run it. A link to the world file would be nice though.
content.html: To downstream users, this could just be referred to as detachable_joint.sdf, because that's how they can run it. A link to the world file would be nice though.

content.raw: Just checking if we should do anything else here, like destroying the joint or removing it from the map?
content.html: Just checking if we should do anything else here, like destroying the joint or removing it from the map?

content.raw: Just a note that once pull request #541 is in, adding to the `MinimumFeatureList` should be considered a breakable change.
content.html: Just a note that once pull request #541 is in, adding to the MinimumFeatureList should be considered a breakable change.

content.raw: Or maybe you meant to check `if (kNullEntity != this->parentLinkEntity)` during `PreUpdate`?
content.html: Or maybe you meant to check if (kNullEntity != this->parentLinkEntity) during PreUpdate?

content.raw: Should we print an error if this element is not present? Otherwise `parentLinkEntity` will be null.
content.html: Should we print an error if this element is not present? Otherwise parentLinkEntity will be null.

content.raw: `parentLinkName` doesn't seem to be used outside this block. Does it need to be a member variable?
content.html: parentLinkName doesn't seem to be used outside this block. Does it need to be a member variable?

content.raw: This is not a pointer, right?
content.html: This is not a pointer, right?

content.raw: Could you document the struct and every member?
content.html: Could you document the struct and every member?

update.description:
Adds a system that initially attaches two models via a fixed joint and allows for the models to get detached during simulation via a topic. 

Needs [ign-physics PR #102](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/102)
update.title: Detachable joint system

content.raw: Yes, good catch! However, we're going to remove this component and create a component for the `self_collide` element. We will add the `InitialModelSdf` as a private component in PR #545. I'll fix the second template argument there.
content.html: Yes, good catch! However, we're going to remove this component and create a component for the self_collide element. We will add the InitialModelSdf as a private component in PR #545. I'll fix the second template argument there.

content.raw: Not sure what the effect would be, should the second argument of the template be different than the `Model` component? @{557058:90bc87b0-2886-4377-a17c-3a6629a697ff}
content.html: Not sure what the effect would be, should the second argument of the template be different than the Model component? @Addisu Z. Taddese

content.raw: It's because of [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/440/detachable-joint-system/diff#Lsrc/systems/physics/Physics.ccT350) change. The `InitialModelSdf` component is now required by physics, but it wasn't being created in the test. The implication is that we can't create a model entity without an SDFormat representation of the model. I feel like this is somewhat of a major design decision though. Maybe we should discuss this at our meeting.
content.html: It's because of this change. The InitialModelSdf component is now required by physics, but it wasn't being created in the test. The implication is that we can't create a model entity without an SDFormat representation of the model. I feel like this is somewhat of a major design decision though. Maybe we should discuss this at our meeting.

content.raw: The changes look fine to me, but I'm curious why the previous imperative approach was not working... :thinking:
content.html: The changes look fine to me, but I'm curious why the previous imperative approach was not working...
